result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A. Sonnheim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Interfere w/ Child Custody-Other Parent, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Prison sentence on Ct 5 in this same case but consecutive to any other sentence including Eau Claire County case 15CF1273

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant to undergo a mental health/psychological assessment, follow all recommendations, and release all records to the agent.   Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. He is to have no alcohol on any premises he occupies even if it belongs to someone else.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
The defendant shall have no contact with Anita Sonnheim or her residence or his son, Anthony  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way without the consent of Anita Sonnheim and his agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

Bond from cases 15CM216 and 15CM213 will be applied to restitution. Remaining restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  The State granted 30 days to determine the restitution amount owed.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Extended supervision on Ct 5 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified,  but consecutive to any other sentence, including Eau Claire County case 15CF1273.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence including Eau Claire County case 15Cf1273 but concurrent to Ct 1 in this same case.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence including Eau Claire County case 15CF1273.  Extended supervision on Ct 1 in this same case.
